questions.question: 1. If the flow time of a sugar solution is longer than the flow time of water in the viscometer,  what can be inferred about the viscosity of the sugar solution?

answers.a: The sugar solution has a higher viscosity than water
answers.b: The sugar solution has a lower viscosity than water
answers.c: The viscosity of the sugar solution cannot be determined
answers.d: The viscosity of the sugar solution is the same as water

questions.question: 2. What does the slope of the plot of Î· (viscosity) against concentration of sucrose indicate
3. Why is the Ostwald viscometer suitable for this experiment?

answers.a: It can handle large volumes of liquid
answers.b: It measures the velocity of flowing liquids
answers.c: It provides precise measurements of viscosity
answers.d: It uses gravity to drive the flow of liquids.

questions.question: 4. Why is it important to measure the density of the sugar solutions accurately in this experiment

answers.a: Density affects the taste of the solutions.
answers.b: Density is used to calculate the coefficient of viscosity
answers.c: Density affects the color of the solutions.
answers.d: Density is used to calculate the volume of the solutions.

questions.question: 5. How would the results have been affected if the capillary tube used in the Ostwald viscometer had a larger diameter

answers.a: Viscosity measurements would have been more accurate.
answers.b: Viscosity measurements would have been less accurate.
answers.c: Viscosity measurements would not have been affected.
answers.d: Diameter of the capillary tube does not affect viscosity measurements.
